channel.title: Lower cache loaded by client
channel.description:
Basically what I want to try to do is make it so my client and source loads a lower cache. Perhaps to reduce some lag. The source I'm using is Rune-Evolution 742. I'd like to lower this down to maybe 728 or so. How would I go about doing this? Would I just switch out the cache in the server and change the cache in the location my client loads it from? Would I have to edit any files in the client?
Also, if someone could provide a 718/728 cache, that would be appreciated as well. Fully packed.. Maps, items, whatever else..
Thank you in advance
Edit: Also, if you know any other ways to reduce lag within this server.. Would be much appreciated as well :)

item.title: Lower cache loaded by client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

bonto:

Alright, thought I heard somewhere that lowering cache could reduce some lag. But guess I heard wrong thanks. Then I just need to figure out how to get rid of some lag… Besides the obvious option of buying a new computer

Find memory leaks within the server and fix them.
Get a vps?
Better internet?
More RAM for the computer?

Read full topic

item.title: Lower cache loaded by client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The lag has nothing to do with your cache.
Plus, if you do this, a lot of items in your game may not work anymore, or not be there.

Read full topic
